doc.name: HlaAttributeReflector
doc.description:
This actor produces an output event whenever the specified attribute of the specified instance is updated by another federate in the federation. In HLA, the terminology is that this actor "reflects" the specified attribute value whenever another federate "updates" the attribute value. The time stamp of the output depends on the parameters of the org.hlacerti.lib.HlaManager, as explained in the documentation for that class. This actor assumes that there is exactly one HlaManager in the model that contains this actor.

The attribute that this actor reflects is specified using three parameters. The className parameter is used to discover an instance of the specified class whose name matches the instanceName parameter. When such an instance is discovered, this actor begins reflecting any updates to the attribute, specified by attributeName, of that instance of that class. The className and attributeName are required to match a class and attribute specified in the FED file that is specified in the HlaManager.

FIXME: Explain the data types. This actor is associated with a unique HLA attribute of a given object instance. Reflected values of this HLA attribute are received from the HLA Federation by the org.hlacerti.lib.HlaManager attribute deployed in the same model. The org.hlacerti.lib.HlaManager invokes the putReflectedAttribute() to put the received value in the HlaAttributeReflector actor token queue and to program its firing time, using the _fireAt() method.

Parameters className and attributeName need to match the name of the class and the name of the attribute defined in the Federate Object Model (FOM) specified for the Federation and indicated in the FED file. The data type of the output port of this actor must have the same type of the HLA attribute (defined in the FOM, not present in the FED file).

The parameter instanceName is chosen by the user.

Entering in more details: This actor provides 3 information: a class name C, an attribute name attr and an instance name i. To each HlaAttributeReflector actor in a Ptolemy model (federate) corresponds a unique org.hlacerti.lib.HlaPublisher actor in a (unique) federate with the same information. Let us recall some terms: - FOM: Federation Object Model - FED: Federation Execution Data, contains classes and attributes defined in the FOM and, for each attribute, if it is timestamped and its QoS - RTI: Run-Time Infrastructure. The RTI has a Central RTI Component (CRC) and one or more Local RTI Components (LRC). The LRC has a numerical representation (handle) for all object classes and object class attributes contained in the FED file. The information supplied in this actor by the user is used in the following way by the org.hlacerti.lib.HlaManager attribute (deployed in the same model): 1. During the initialization phase, the org.hlacerti.lib.HlaManager: - Subscribes to all the kattr-kC (gathered from kclassHandleC; _attributesLocal is the set constructed by calling rtia.getAttributeHandle() for each attrC); - Receives the HLA callback informing the discovering of an instance of class C named i: rtia.discoverObjectInstance(objectInstanceId, classHandle, someName), with someName = i; objectInstanceId and classHandle are handles provided by the RTI. 2. During the simulation loop phase, the org.hlacerti.lib.HlaManager receives the RAV callback from the RTI with the new value of an attribute of a class instance. Each HlaAttributeReflector actor is related to one RAV callback: rtia.reflectAttributeValues(objectInstanceId, suppAttributes, tag, ravTimeStamp). The RAV callback, with a timestamp t'=ravTimeStamp<\i> is received at the input port of the HlaPublisher actor, during the advance time phase that starts when the federate wants to advanced its time to t<\i> (using NER or TAR time management, see org.hlacerti.lib.HlaManager code). The optional parameter tag is not used in the current implementation.
